tuv.seg: Since the 2014 local elections there are 31 local authorities with a total of 949 members known as councillors
Ó thoghcháin áitiúla 2014, tá 31 údarás áitiúil ann ina bhfuil 949 comhalta, ar an iomlán, ar a dtugtar comhairlí
Under the Local Government Reform Act 2014 the town authorities were replaced by a system of 95 municipal districts, integrating town and county governance, and certain local authorities were merged

Faoin Acht um Athchóiriú Rialtais Áitiúil, 2014, cuireadh córas de 95 ceantar bardasach in ionad na n-údarás baile, a rinne rialachas baile agus contae a chomhdhlúthú, agus rinneadh roinnt údaráis áitiúla a chónascadh
There are 26 county councils and they are responsible for local government in 24 geographical counties including the county of Dublin
Tá 26 comhairle contae ann agus tá siad freagrach as an rialtas áitiúil in 24 contae tíreolaíoch, lena n-áirítear contae Bhaile Átha Cliath
Dublin county has 3 county councils – South Dublin County Council, Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council and Fingal County Council
Tá 3 chomhairle contae i gcontae Bhaile Átha Cliath – Comhairle Contae Bhaile Átha Cliath Theas, Comhairle Contae Dhún Laoghaire-Ráth an Dúin agus Comhairle Contae Fhine Gall
There are 2 city and county councils
Tá dhá chomhairle cathrach agus contae
They are responsible for local government in Limerick (Limerick City and County Council) and Waterford (Waterford City and County Council)
Tá siad freagrach as rialtas áitiúil i Luimneach (Comhairle Cathrach agus Contae Luimnigh) agus i bPort Láirge (Comhairle Cathrach agus Contae Phort Láirge)
There are 3 city councils and they are responsible for local government in the cities of Dublin, Cork and Galway
Tá 3 chomhairle cathrach ann agus tá siad freagrach as rialtas áitiúil i gcathracha Bhaile Átha Cliath, Chorcaí agus na Gaillimhe
The number of members that can be elected to a council depends on the size of the county's population
Braitheann an líon comhaltaí is féidir a thoghadh le comhairle ar mhéid dhaonra an chontae
For example, Cork County Council has 55 members and Carlow County Council has only 18
Mar shampla, tá 55 comhalta i gComhairle Contae Chorcaí agus níl ach 18 gcomhalta ag Comhairle Contae Cheatharlach
The number of members in each council is set out in Section 15 of the 2014 Act
Leagtar amach an líon comhaltaí i ngach comhairle in Alt 15 d’Acht 2014
The council has jurisdiction or control throughout its administrative area
Tá dlínse nó rialú ag an gcomhairle ar fud a gceantair riaracháin
Each council has a chief executive, previously known as city or county manager, who is the manager of the local authority
Tá príomhfheidhmeannach ag gach comhairle, ar ar tugadh bainisteoir cathrach nó contae roimhe seo, a fheidhmíonn mar bhainisteoir an údaráis áitiúil
You can find your local authority’s details on the Local Government Management Agency (LGMA) website
Féadfaidh tú teacht ar shonraí faoi d’údarás áitiúil ar láithreán gréasáin na Gníomhaireachta Bainistíochta Rialtais Áitiúil (GBRA)
Under the 2014 Act each council administrative area, apart from the 3 Dublin county councils and the 3 city councils, has a system of municipal districts based on electoral areas

Faoi Acht 2014, tá córas de cheantair bhardasacha ag gach ceantar riaracháin chomhairle, seachas ó na 3 chomhairle contae i mBaile Átha Cliath agus na 3 chomhairle cathrach, atá bunaithe ar thoghcheantair
Each council has at least two municipal districts
Tá ar a laghad dhá cheantar bhardasacha ag gach comhairle
For example, Kilkenny County Council has 3 municipal districts
Mar shampla, tá 3 cheantar bhardasacha ag Comhairle Contae Chill Chainnigh
The local authority members elected from these municipal districts take certain decisions in relation to the districts
Déanann na comhaltaí údaráis áitiúil a thoghtar ó na ceantair bhardasacha seo roinnt cinntí maidir leis na ceantair
Certain municipal districts may be known as metropolitan districts or borough districts
D’fhéadfaí ceantair chathrach nó ceantair bhuirge a thabhairt ar roinnt ceantair bhardasacha
The councils in Dublin and the city councils may establish area committees, but they do not have the same functions as municipal districts
Féadfaidh na comhairlí i mBaile Átha Cliath agus na comhairlí cathrach coistí ceantair a bhunú, ach ní bhíonn an fheidhm chéanna acu a bhíonn ag ceantair bhardasacha
